HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR
full_text:
AEDE
Elz ae
2020/KER/360
IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM
PRESENT
THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON
TUESDAY, THE 07TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 17TH POUSHA, 1941
Cr1.MC.No.5721 OF 2013
AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 99/2012 OF CHIEF JUDICIAL
MAGISTRATE ,TRIVANDRUM/SPECIAL COURT FOR TRIAL OF CYBER CRIME
CRIME NO.682/2011 OF Museum Police Station, Thiruvananthapuram
PETITIONER/ACCUSED:
VIJAYAN MENON
T C 36/1018, THIRUVATHIRA,
ENCHAKKAL , THITRUVANANTHAPURAM - 695 008
BY ADVS.
SRI .K.RAMAKUMAR (SR.)
SRI .S.M.PRASANTH
SMT.ASHA BABU
SMT.AMMU CHARLES
RESPONDENTS/STATE & COMPLAINANT:
1 STATE OF KERALA
REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR,
HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031.
2 THE STATION HOUSE OFFICER
MUSEUM POLICE STATION,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM - 695 001
3 UDAYA BABURAJ,
AGED 43 YEARS, S/O.GOPINATHAN,
PUTHUVAL PUTHEN VEEDU, VETTUKAD MURI,
KADAKAMPALLY VILLAGE, VETTUCAUD,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
R1-R2 BY SRI.E.C.BINESH, PP
R3 BY ADV. KAMALESWARAM S.
MANIKANTAN NAIR
OTHER PRESENT:
THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON
07.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

_
Be

Crl1.M.C.No.5721 of 2013 > 2020/KER/360

ORDER
Dated this the 7th day of January 2020

The petitioner is arraigned as the 374 accused in
C.C.No.99/2012 on the file of the Chief Judicial
Magistrate Court, Thiruvananthapuram, for having
allegedly committed the offences punishable under
Sections 420, 464, 468, 470, 471 read with Section 34
of I.P.C. along with two other accused. The specific
allegation is that the accused persons had induced the
defacto complainant to purchase a Hyundai Accent Car
bearing Reg.No.KL-01-AB-914, registered in the name of
the 3%? accused, making him believe that the vehicle has
run only 71,000 kms. and thereby inducing him to
deliver a sum of Rs.2,10,000/- as consideration. It is
understood that the odometer of the vehicle was
tampered with and that the defacto complainant was
cheated and he filed a complaint. The specific
allegation in the final report itself is that the
accused 1 and 2 had introduced somebody as the 379
accused-Vijayan Menon. The specific case of the
petitioner is that he was abroad at that time and

Enron.

Be
Crl1.M.C.No.5721 of 2013 3 2020/KER/360
therefore could not have participated in the alleged
sale of the vehicle to the complainant resulting in the
alleged cheating.

2. A report was called for from the investigating
officer and in the first report it is very specifically
stated by the Sub Inspector that the other accused had
introduced somebody as the 3*4 accused by his name, but
he has no specific case that the 3** accused was present
in person for the alleged transaction. Copy of the
document has also been produced by the 3*7* accused to
indicate that he had arrived in India only after the
alleged transaction and therefore he could not have
been present for the alleged transaction. A further
report was called for regarding the presence of the
petitioner/accused on the date of occurrence and
further time was sought by the investigating authority
to verify the matter with the FRRO Thiruvananthapuram
regarding the arrival of the petitioner. But no report
has been filed so far.

3. Final report has been filed and the matter is
pending before the Chief Judicial Magistrate,

Enron.

Be
Crl1.M.C.No.5721 of 2013 4 2020/KER/360
Thiruvananthapuram. In view of the stay against the 37?
accused, the trial has not yet been proceeded.
Considering the entire available materials on record,
there is every possibility that the petitioner was not
present on the alleged date of occurrence and therefore
the very substance of the case of the prosecution as
against the 3%? accused does not have legs to stand on.

I am convinced about the non-maintainability of the
case against the petitioner and therefore the Crl1.M.C.
is allowed and the entire proceedings against the
petitioner in C.C.No.99/2012 on the file of the Chief
Judicial Magistrate Court, Thiruvananthapuram, stands
quashed under Section 482, Cr.P.C. and the petitioner
is discharged.
Sd/-
dkr ASHOK MENON
JUDGE

AEDE
Bln a ve
Crl.M.C.No.5721 of 2013 2020/KER/360
5
APPENDIX

PASSPORT OF THE PETITIONER
